semantic_title: Physical Restraint Status (Z78.1) - Documentation Requirements and Usage Restrictions
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors Influencing Health Status > c. Categories of Z Codes > 3) Status

content.full_text: Code Z78.1, Physical restraint status, may be used when it is documented by the provider that a patient has been put in restraints during the current encounter. Please note that this code should not be reported when it is documented by the provider that a patient is temporarily restrained during a procedure. (Evidence: pg no: 95, L61)
content.summary: Z78.1 for physical restraint status requires provider documentation but excludes temporary procedural restraints (Evidence: pg no: 95, L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not report for temporary restraints during procedures (Evidence: pg no: 95, L61)
detailed_rules.explanation: Z78.1 should not be used when restraints are temporary and only for procedural purposes (Evidence: pg no: 95, L61)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Review provider documentation for restraint use
Step 2: Determine if restraints were for procedure only
Step 3: If non-procedural restraints, assign Z78.1
Step 4: If procedural restraints only, do not assign Z78.1
